A guide on how to live a meaningful life.

The most successful people I know and have met have one common trait. An irresistible curiosity in whatever they do.

This curiosity asks questions, pushes them into new experiences, and also rewards them with unexpected opportunities.

The opposite of that is betting with your life on a set path that was handed to you by others.

Be born, do what others say, study hard, graduate, marry, have children, work from 9 to 5, retire, travel, die.

Humans are inherently social and peer pressure is a real thing. It forces many to comply with whatever system they are born into so they can fit in. However, that path makes you invisible.

If you follow a set path, one that was handed to you by others, you may emerge later in life with a deep sense of frustration, or worst, a feeling of being disempowered and expecting others to rescue you (like say the government).

A curious person pursuing their interests will inevitably set their life on a different trajectory, one that will certainly not make them invisible, at least not to the people that share their interests.

This point is critical.

You need to stand out in some form to break away from the "being invisible" barrier.

You can do that in countless ways, but not many choose the unexpected, the unplanned, the uncertain.

Yet, that uncertainty is what provides the opportunity to become visible.

When I first bought Bitcoin at $700 I was acting on a curiosity. There was no certainty of outcome, but it definitely put me in a very tiny minority. 

That has changed today, but anyone acting on that impulse a decade ago has definitely changed the original path that was already set for them.

Even today, holding any amount of Bitcoin places you in a very exclusive and privileged group. You are definitely not invisible in that sense. You are quite unique among 8 billion people.

This uniqueness makes your path in life stand out from the average. That also brings opportunities that would not have otherwise been available to you.

Because of this curiosity, your path in life is no longer set by others, but by yourself and your actions. This is incredibly stimulating and meaningful.

You no longer wait for others to rescue you, rather youâ€™ve rescued yourself already. This attitude compounds very quickly, similar to how a portfolio compounds faster and faster after 10 years.

Now, the same principle applies to everything in life, including in the choice of a partner or spouse. Are they curious about any particular thing? Do they ask questions?

There is nothing wrong with an invisible life following a set path handed down by others. However, there is nothing unique or interesting about that.

The reason Bitcoin hit 126k this year is because it is unique and scarce/rare. By contrast, the price of oil has been in the same range for the past 50 years. Nothing unique or scarce about that.

Whatever the purpose of life may be, one thing is certain. New experiences lead to new data. That allows the creation of a more fulfilling life.

Think of it in AI terms. 

AI development needs more and more data, but this data is meaningless if it is the same information duplicated 100 times. If itâ€™s not unique in some form, after a point, itâ€™s useless to further advance an AI.

You cannot break the invisibility barrier if your daily dose of new experiences is zero. You need a trigger to break the routine or that set path. If youâ€™re at that point in life where you need a trigger, embrace it, donâ€™t avoid it.

If you donâ€™t do it yourself, life has a way of doing it for you, but in those cases, the experiences that follow may not be the ones you wanted.

Still, even if they are unwanted or unpleasant, embrace those experiences. Because they enable new data critical to your success later.

This is why some of the most successful people we know failed many times, but every time that happened, they picked themselves up and tried again. 

In fact, they were just acquiring new data/experience until they became successful andâ€¦ unique.

No path is the same. 

Just dare to walk your path and follow your curiosity, wherever it may lead. Life will take care of the rest.

Thatâ€™s how a meaningful life is created. 

For you, not for others. 

Remember, you are the one experiencing it, hence be very careful when you accept the opinions of others about how you should live your life. They donâ€™t know your path!
